commit message: initial import
Add Settings, adjust main screen
Now setting configuration in a sqlite database
Should be an equal sign
Remove backup file and unused line from the main activity
Add a README
Add Internet permissions, implement a simple synchronizer that just spits out the site pointed at by the settings
Read out org files into a HashMap so we can fetch them (soon)
Build a full request for each org file listed in the index
Refactor the synchronizer
Download org files and store them locally.  Fill table with file names and Descriptions (no Checksum information just yet)
Now populating the main display with the list of synced org files.  Uses their description fetched from the index file
Fix a few bugs
Start simple text display view when a file is clicked, log the display name... we'll soon use this to lookup the filename

Fix a bug where we weren't parsing the org file url correctly, resulting in empty files.  Now can populate the display with an org file.  There is a sync bug where all stored file data is quashed by one entry when syncing after the first time
Adding files needed to show the org file
Fix some bugs, like a bad update that corrupted the database.  There's still a bug where a Sync doesn't update the main display
Refresh display on Sync
Clean up, trying to make the settings UI look a little better.  Not quite there yet.  Adding the shell of what will become the Org File Parser based on the MobileOrg code
added .gitignore and removed files that shouldn't be under version control
Some small updates and merging in Dan Larkin's cleanup changes
Skeletal Node implementation and linkage to parser
Filling in more Node elements, this will be somewhat of a wrapper around the arraylist and payloads
Initial full implementation of the parser
Parser appears to work okay, fix some other bugs
Reworking the Data Model to fall under the main activity with a tree of Nodes.
Enable the display, OrgFileParser is horribly broken
Handle the case where it is at the same depth
First level file parsing seems to work well, not picking up on multiple files for some reason
Reset node level before reading the file
Now display all files, and creating the data structure the right way
Tweak font and container sizes for the list display
Finally the main display is working... this is the first really functional version of this application, though still very inefficient.  The major issue now is optimizing the main activity launching
Remove the parser in this activity ... it was just a placeholder
Now storing the state in the Application object in order to re-use the Activity context
Reference the Application Object, only reload the datastructures if needed
Fix a bug where we weren't actually looking at the selection container to get the selected item stack.
Run parser after Sync
Enabling text view from a context menu accessed by longclick on the listview
Updating application icon
Implement a dialog that informs the user that we are synchronizing
Implement a notification dialog if the sync fails that allows the user to retry or cancel.
Add the heading of the selected item to the top of the document.
View as document if there are no more layers to drill into.
Make the settings view a little easier to read by giving the boxes more room
Better look for the textview in the listview layout
Make the context menu button the width of the screen, and update the name of the application instead of using the name of the main activity
Adding a copy of the GPL
Fix a bug introduced in the manifest
